DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of the cognitive-behavioral treatment program CANDIS among n=450 patients with cannabis use disorders in a mulicenter randomized-controlled clinical trial (n=11 outpatient treatment centers).
DOC.brief_title: CANDIS-II: Evaluation of the Cognitive-behavioral Treatment Programme CANDIS
DOC.criteria: motivation to change cannabis use age 16 or older current (12 mth) regular cannabis use (at least 2 days a week) informed consent to the study procedures and assessments current alcohol or any illicit drug dependence syndrome according to DSMIV other than due to cannabis lifetime history of any psychotic disorder current severe episode of Major depression current panicagoraphobic disorder (severe) severe learning disability, brain damage or pervasive developmental disorder currently acute suicidality not fluent in german language any other current treatment for cannabis use disorders
DOC.keyword: efficacy of CBT for cannabis use disorders
